sentences.english: Gambling revenues jumped 59% compared to the previous November.
sentences.chinese: 賭博業收入與去年同期相比激增了59%。

sentences.english: The fees and penalty charges ballooned.
sentences.chinese: 花費和罰款費用一路激增。

sentences.english: Lionfish populations have exploded in the past few years.
sentences.chinese: 獅子魚的數量在過去幾年裏激增。

sentences.english: The monstrous billows surge up high.
The new version could spark a pickup in sales, Sperry predicted.
sentences.chinese: 史貝莉預測，新版本可能會讓銷售量激增。

sentences.english: The value of exports surged last year.
During this time the herd swells with thousands of bleating baby wildebeests.
sentences.chinese: 這個時期種羣的數量因爲幾千頭新生牛羚而激增。

sentences.english: Demand for low-end cellphones has surged across emerging markets since the economic crisis began to ease.
sentences.chinese: 經濟危機緩和後整個新興市場對低端手機需求量激增。

sentences.english: Globalwarming has long been blamed for the huge rise in the world's jellyfishpopulation.
sentences.chinese: 長期以來，全球變暖被認爲是水母數量激增的原因。

sentences.english: The project now has multiple full-time psychiatrists.
sentences.chinese: 如今，該項目參與的全職精神科醫生激增數倍。

sentences.english: Despite the difficulties, investors assume such deals will continue to proliferate.
sentences.chinese: 儘管困難重重，投資者認爲這種交易仍將繼續激增。

sentences.english: But for some people merely imagining this scene creates an adrenaline surge.
sentences.chinese: 但是對於某些人但是想象這一幕就會腎上腺素激增。

sentences.english: But if they back off and it suddenly surges, they will be blamed.
sentences.chinese: 但如果他們讓步而病毒激增，那麼專家會遭受指責。

sentences.english: City growth far outran the general population boom.
sentences.chinese: 城市的發展大大超過總的人口激增。

sentences.english: Corruption, economic mismanagement, repression and instability will proliferate.
sentences.chinese: 腐敗，經濟管理不善，壓迫和不穩定將激增。

sentences.english: Membership of the club has ballooned beyond all expectations.
sentences.chinese: 該俱樂部會員人數出乎意料地激增了。

definition: to clamber up/(of prices etc) to rise
(of water) to soar/(of prices) to skyrocket
year after year/with each passing year/over the years
to increase steadily/to grow with each passing day
to decline/to drop/to fall/to go down/to decrease
to increase by degrees/in increasing order/incremental/progressive
